body_html:
As this method defined:

tf.assign_add

assign_add(
    ref,
    value,
    use_locking=None,
    name=None
)

Args:

  • ref: A mutable Tensor.

So accum_grad must be reference-typed.

The most common way to create a reference-typed tensor is to define a tf.Variable

From stackoverflow

As this method defined:
tf.assign_add

assign_add(
    ref,
    value,
    use_locking=None,
    name=None
)
Args:

ref: A mutable Tensor.

So accum_grad must be reference-typed.

The most common way to create a reference-typed tensor is to define a tf.Variable

From stackoverflow
body:
As this method defined:

```python
tf.assign_add

assign_add(
    ref,
    value,
    use_locking=None,
    name=None
)
```

**Args:**

- ref: A mutable Tensor.

So `accum_grad` must be reference-typed.

> The most common way to create a reference-typed tensor is to define a tf.Variable

From [stackoverflow](https://stackoverflow.com/a/37959933/3167471)
